head.title: Gunmen Injure 4 People in Crowd Outside a Restaurant in Queens

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Gunmen Injure 4 People in Crowd Outside a Restaurant in Queens

abstract.p: Several men turned away from private party at Porterhouse Grill in Fresh Meadows section of Queens return in fit of anger and begin shooting at group outside, injuring four people; Anwar Griffin, Luis Koonce and Shawn Anderson are charged with attempted murder (S)

block.p: Several men who were turned away from a private party at a Queens restaurant early yesterday morning returned in a fit of anger and began shooting at a group outside, injuring four people, the police said.

The shooting began at 3:30 a.m. outside the Porterhouse Grill at 193rd Street and Union Turnpike in Fresh Meadows, where the men had been denied entry, said Sgt. Gerry Falcon, a police spokeswoman. At least three of the men had handguns, the police said, and more than 25 rounds were fired into the crowd.

Several men who were turned away from a private party at a Queens restaurant early yesterday morning returned in a fit of anger and began shooting at a group outside, injuring four people, the police said.

The shooting began at 3:30 a.m. outside the Porterhouse Grill at 193rd Street and Union Turnpike in Fresh Meadows, where the men had been denied entry, said Sgt. Gerry Falcon, a police spokeswoman. At least three of the men had handguns, the police said, and more than 25 rounds were fired into the crowd.

The police identified the injured as Carlos Mendez, 25, who was shot twice in the thigh; Thomas Davis, 26, who was hit once in the arm; Dawn Scott, 25, who was shot in both legs and in the stomach; and Jermaine Futrell, 22, who was hit in the leg. All were in stable condition at area hospitals yesterday afternoon.

Police officers from the 107th Precinct arrested two Queens men at the scene, Anwar Griffin, 17, of 117-15 195th Street, and Luis Koonce, 21, of 190-05 Linden Boulevard. They were charged with attempted murder, assault, reckless endangerment and criminal possession of a weapon.

A third man, Shawn Anderson, 22, of 89-30 187th Place, faced the same charges after the police arrested him at Queens General Hospital. Sergeant Falcon said Mr. Anderson had escaped from the scene with another man in a van, but he had been shot in the hand outside the restaurant and had later taken a taxicab to the hospital so he could be treated.
The other man in the van had not been arrested as of last night.
